data.title: Rodney “Rod” Stewart (1937-2012)
data.meta_description: AUGUSTA – Rodney “Rod” Stewart, 74, of Belgrade, formerly of Hallowell, died Thursday, Sept. 27, 2012, at Maine General Medical Center in Augusta.
data.text:
AUGUSTA – Rodney “Rod” Stewart, 74, of Belgrade, formerly of Hallowell, died Thursday, Sept. 27, 2012, at Maine General Medical Center in Augusta.

He was born Nov. 26, 1937, in New Vineyard, a son of Ardene “Dean” and Alice (Merry) Stewart and was a graduate of Farmington High School and later Husson College in Bangor.

On Nov. 25, 1960, he married Helen “Vicki” Tracy at St. Mary’s Church in Bangor. Mr. Stewart worked in sales for Libby Foods, Xerox, and Superior Concrete in Auburn. He also worked in real estate sales and in 1987, together with Bruce Johnson, created Eco-Tec, a company that distributed the first preformed products used for septic systems, in the New England and Atlantic Canada.

He retired in 1995 to become a “gentleman” farmer at his home in Belgrade and work with his Kubota tractor.

Rod’s favorite job was being a grandfather, and he truly enjoyed playing golf and was known to have “played the most rounds of golf, without ever having a hole-in-one.”

He is survived by his wife of nearly 52 years, Helen “Vicki” of Belgrade; son Brett Stewart and his wife, Susan Salisbury of Gorham; daughter, Tracy Stewart and her companion Dana Landeck of Saco; son, Christopher Stewart and his wife, Lisa of Sparland, IL and son, Bruce Stewart and his wife, Shari of Albuquerque, NM; brother, Lee “Sonny” Stewart of Temple and a sister, Carolee Merrill and her husband, Eddie of New Vineyard; eight grandchildren, Stewart Dupuis, Molly Stewart, Rachael Stewart, Dylan Frank, Mitchell Frank, Keegan Stewart, Aspen Stewart, and Colin Stewart; a brother-in-law, Glen Farmer of West Farmington.

He was predeceased by his sister, Eletrice Farmer.

Public memorial visitation will be held on Tuesday from 5-7 p.m. at the Wiles Remembrance Center, 137 Farmington Falls Road, Farmington. Private family services will be at Fairview Cemetery in Farmington. The family suggests that those who desire, consider memorial gifts in Rod’s memory to the American Heart Association, Maine Affiliate, Inc., 51 US Route 1, Suite M, Scarborough, ME 04072.
